meanings.definition: Displaying a wide black band at the top and bottom of a television or movie screen to maintain the original aspect ratio.
meanings.sent1: The letterboxed movie looked so cool on our TV.
meanings.sent2: The film was letterboxed to keep the full picture.
meanings.sent3: I felt like I was watching a secret message in the letterboxed show.
meanings.sent4: The letterboxed scene framed the action perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The letterboxed format made the movie feel cinematic.

meanings.definition: To format a video or film with black bars at the top and bottom to preserve the original widescreen format.
meanings.sent1: We need to letterboxed this video for the big screen.
meanings.sent2: The director decided to letterboxed the movie for the festival.
meanings.sent3: I will letterboxed our family video for fun.
meanings.sent4: She letterboxed the film to keep the widescreen look.
meanings.sent5: They will letterboxed the documentary to show it in theaters.
